str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Full of darkness, dark. From skotos; opaque, i.e. benighted.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.
